alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 28 at 3:21AM CDT until October 28 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Widespread sub-freezing temperatures as cold as 25 to 29 degrees expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Mid to high level clouds have stabilized temperatures in the mid to upper 20s early this morning, with some areas even seeing a slight rise in temperatures. However, the entire Warning area has now registered at least one, if not a few freezes already this fall, effectively ending the 2023 growing season area-wide and making additional Freeze Warnings unnecessary. Even colder overnight low temperatures in the teens and low 20s are likely over the next couple of nights.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
